title: Revise Colors and Icons for Devlog Status, Priority, and Type
description: Revise the color scheme and icon selection for devlog status, priority, and type tags to improve visual hierarchy, accessibility, and user experience. This includes updating the devlog-ui-utils.tsx utility functions and ensuring consistent application across all components.

notes.content:
Analyzed current implementation and identified key issues:

Current Problems:
- All type tags use the same blue color making them indistinguishable  
- Status colors use basic Ant Design defaults without semantic meaning
- Priority icons are inconsistent (info-circle vs warning mix)
- No cohesive visual hierarchy between status/priority/type

Observed from UI:
- Status: New (blue), Done (green), High priority (orange) 
- Priority: Medium (info-circle), High (warning) - inconsistent icon weight
- Type: All use blue + different icons (star, bug, tool, check-circle)

Next: Design improved color scheme with better semantic meaning and visual hierarchy

Successfully implemented improved color scheme and icon updates:

✅ **Status Colors Improved:**
- New: blue (clear starting point)
- In Progress: orange (active attention needed) 
- Done: green (completed successfully)
- Blocked: red (critical attention)
- In Review: purple (evaluation phase)
- Testing: cyan (verification)

✅ **Priority Colors Enhanced:**
- Critical: red (urgent)
- High: volcano (warm orange-red) 
- Medium: gold (balanced)
- Low: lime (calm green)

✅ **Type Colors Added (no longer all blue!):**
- Feature: geekblue (new functionality)
- Bug Fix: magenta (attention-getting)
- Task: purple (general work)
- Refactor: cyan (technical)
- Docs: green (knowledge-based)

✅ **Icon Consistency:**
- Updated status icons for better semantic meaning (plus for new, sync for in-progress)
- Maintained consistent visual weight across priority icons
- All type icons remain clear and distinctive

The visual hierarchy is now much clearer - users can instantly distinguish between different types of work and their status/priority levels!

Completed: Successfully revised the color scheme and icon system for devlog status, priority, and type tags. Implemented semantic color meanings that improve visual hierarchy and user experience. All type tags now have distinctive colors (no longer all blue), status colors better reflect work states, and priority colors create clear urgency indicators. Created comprehensive documentation of the new visual design system.

context.businessContext: Clear visual differentiation of devlog properties helps users quickly scan and understand the state of their work. Better color choices and more intuitive icons reduce cognitive load and improve productivity.
context.technicalContext: Current implementation uses basic Ant Design tag colors and some mismatched icons. We need to create a more coherent visual system that follows modern design principles and accessibility guidelines.
acceptanceCriteria: Updated color scheme for status tags with better semantic meaning
Improved icon selection for all categories with consistent visual weight
Enhanced type tag colors (currently only using blue)
Maintained accessibility standards for color contrast
Updated documentation of visual design decisions
